org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.HAL

Class Xbox360Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team1736.lib.HAL.Xbox360Controller

  • public class Xbox360Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    DESCRIPTION:
    This class was created purely in an effort to make controller calls less clunky overall. Not terribly useful, but hopefully way easier than typing out a super long string every time you want to call a controller button.
    I don't want to put "get" in front of my methods because that'll make the calls ever so slightly longer, so I won't. As Chris says, "If later we don't like it, we'll change it."

    USAGE:
    1. Instantiate Class
    2. Call methods to read from controller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Xbox360Controller

        public Xbox360Controller(int joystick_id)
        Set up a new joystick
        Parameters:
        joystick_id - The index to pass to WPIlib for the joystick. Usually 0 is driver1, 1 is driver2, and so on

    • Method Detail

      • setLeftRumble

        public void setLeftRumble(float value)
        Adjust the rumbliness of the left rumble motor.
        Parameters:
        value - Strength of Rumble, 0 is min and 1 is max.

      • setRightRumble

        public void setRightRumble(float value)
        Adjust the rumbliness of the right rumble motor.
        Parameters:
        value - Strength of Rumble, 0 is min and 1 is max.

        public void rumbleOff()
        Turn off all rumble motors

        True if A is pressed, False if A is not pressed

        True if the left bumper button is pressed, False if it is not pressed

      • RB

        public boolean RB()
        Returns:
        True if the right bumper button is pressed, False if it is not pressed

      • BackButton

        public boolean BackButton()
        Returns:
        True if the "Back" button (on top of the controller) is pressed, False if it is not pressed.

      • StartButton

        public boolean StartButton()
        Returns:
        True if the "Start" button (on top of the controller) is pressed, False if it is not pressed.

      • LStickButton

        public boolean LStickButton()
        Returns:
        True if the left stick is depressed, False if it is not pressed.

      • RStickButton

        public boolean RStickButton()
        Returns:
        True if the right stick is depressed, False if it is not pressed.

      • LStick_X

        public double LStick_X()
        Returns:
        Left stick X axis position. 0 is centered, 1 is all the way to the right, -1 is all the way to the left.

      • LStick_Y

        public double LStick_Y()
        Returns:
        Left stick Y axis position. 0 is centered, 1 is all the way to the top, -1 is all the way to the bottom.

      • LTrigger

        public double LTrigger()
        Returns:
        Left trigger depression. 0 is not depressed, 1 is fully pulled in, 0.5 is partially pulled. Note the Xbox underlying hardware ties the left and right triggers together, so pulling both triggers at the same time results in interesting things happening.

      • RTrigger

        public double RTrigger()
        Returns:
        Right trigger depression. 0 is not depressed, 1 is fully pulled in, 0.5 is partially pulled. Note the Xbox underlying hardware ties the left and right triggers together, so pulling both triggers at the same time results in interesting things happening.

      • RStick_X

        public double RStick_X()
        Returns:
        Right stick X axis position. 0 is centered, 1 is all the way to the right, -1 is all the way to the left.

      • RStick_Y

        public double RStick_Y()
        Returns:
        Left stick Y axis position. 0 is centered, 1 is all the way to the top, -1 is all the way to the bottom.

      • DPad

        public int DPad()
        Returns:
        The current "angle" from the DPad (POV switch)

      • DPadUp

        public boolean DPadUp()
        Returns:
        True if the DPad is pushed up, False if it is not pressed

      • DPadRight

        public boolean DPadRight()
        Returns:
        True if the DPad is pushed right, False if it is not pressed
